metadata.synopsis: Astarion wakes up from a terrifying dream of his old master. His master had forbidden him to drink humanoid blood, but his master wasn't there... Astarion looks at the sleeping companions and considers biting one of them. If he does, he rolls a stealth check. If he succeeds, he sucks their blood (he can stop or decide to drain them dry). If he fails they wake up, and have to be convinced not to leave him.

54.speaker: Narrator
54.text: *Cazador. Your Master. You have to get back to him quickly. If you're late, he'll flay you. Again.*
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wake up, trying to breathe, afraid

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *What will he say when he finds you can walk in the sunlight and he can't?*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *And then it dawns on you: if you're free to walk in daylight, can you be free of Cazador too?*

46.speaker: Astarion
46.text: 'First, thou shalt not drink of the blood of thinking creatures.'

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *You look at your companions. Sleeping. Helpless. How badly do you need to know?*
